translation.en: -[Dad] Hello, Georgie. -Hi.
[Dad] How did you feel when you were younger,
translation.ko: 어릴 때 이런 말 들으면 기분이 어땠어?

translation.en: when people would say, "What a beautiful boy," or… you know?
translation.ko: 어릴 때 이런 말 들으면 기분이 어땠어? '남자아이가 참 예쁘장하네' 뭐 그런 말들 있잖니

translation.en: I got a bit frustrated, um, because…
I… I wanted them to understand that I'm a girl.
translation.ko: 난 여자아이라는 걸 다른 사람들도 알아주길 원했어요

translation.en: I'm a girl.
Not… maybe not in the outside, but in the inside, I feel like a girl.
translation.ko: 남들 눈에는 안 그래 보여도 나는 내가 여자인 거 알아요

translation.en: Do you wanna wear different trackie dacks?
That's my fault.
They're longer on me than they are on you. [laughs]
translation.ko: 엄마한테는 더 길었는데 네가 입으니까 짤막하네

translation.en: [Georgie] Yeah.
Yeah, wear your nice blue ones.
-I'll bring these ones instead. Yeah. -Yeah.
It's very surreal for me to think that for most of today, I'll be asleep.
translation.ko: 오늘 하루를 생각하면 꿈 같아요 - 거의 종일 잘 거라잖아요 - 그러게 말이다

translation.en: [Mum] Yeah.
translation.ko: - 거의 종일 잘 거라잖아요 - 그러게 말이다

translation.en: [Georgie] And I keep thinking of the moments that have led me here.
translation.ko: 어떤 순간들을 겪어낸 후에 오늘이 왔는지 그 생각이 머리에서 떠나질 않아요

translation.en: [Mum] Yeah.
[Mum] Pop that next to your bed.
Um…
I'll pop that in there, just in case you need it.
translation.ko: 혹시 필요할지 모르니까 서랍에 넣어 둘게

translation.en: Thanks.
Today is your first day of school.
Can we see you in your uniform, please?
translation.ko: 엄마한테 교복 입은 모습 좀 보여줄래? "5세"

translation.en: Uh, yeah. Uh, Valks…
[Georgie] Yeah, and mine too.
Yeah. Yeah. Yeah.
The most recent swimming carnival at Valkstone
translation.ko: 지난번에 우리 학교에서 수영 축제가 열렸는데요

translation.en: was very…
very frustrating.
I went into the boy's cubicles,
or toilets, to get, um, changed into…
translation.ko: 남자 화장실에 들어가야 했어요 그… 옷을 갈아입으러요

translation.en: changed, um,
when all the boys started laughing at me.
And then I hid in the cubicle.
And then…
my mum thought that maybe I'll get dressed with her
but not in any of the toilets.
We'll get dressed behind the toilets,
where no one could find us.
Yeah.
So I would like to introduce to you the college captains of 2018,
D'Art and Georgie.
[Dad] How do you feel about having a sister and not a brother?
Well, it is quite fun because if we were younger,
translation.ko: 뭐 누나랑 놀면 재밌어서 좋아요 어릴 때는 누나랑 같이 슈퍼히어로 놀이 했어요

translation.en: we can be playing superheroes or something.
translation.ko: 어릴 때는 누나랑 같이 슈퍼히어로 놀이 했어요

translation.en: -[Georgie cheers] -A girl superhero and a boy superhero.
translation.ko: 누나는 여자 슈퍼히어로였고 나는 남자 슈퍼히어로였어요

translation.en: Now we usually play spies,
and there's a woman agent and a man agent.
So it's more fun having a girl around instead of just two boys.
translation.ko: 남자애 둘이서 노는 것보다 여자애 한 명이 있으면 더 재밌죠

translation.en: [Dad] How do you find them at school?
Does everyone at school think of her as a girl? Yeah.
translation.ko: - 다들 조지를 여자로 알고 있니? - 네

translation.en: I crossed my heart that I wouldn't tell anyone.
[Beck] And now one, just the twins.
-How are you feeling, love? -I'm good.
[Beck] Be careful.
Who's taking the coffee machine when Dad moves out?
translation.ko: 아빠가 나가 살기로 했으면 커피 머신은 누가 가져요?

translation.en: I get all the tea stuff, and he gets all the coffee stuff.
translation.ko: 차는 내가 가질 거고 커피는 네 아빠가 챙겼어

translation.en: -The microwave? -[Beck] Staying here.
The Wi-Fi?
[Beck] I don't know 'cause we might go with another company.
The phone?
Stays here.
And it might… have a little bit of a different vibe here,
translation.ko: 아무래도 집 분위기가 좀 달라지긴 하겠지만

translation.en: but we're good at creating homes, Georgie.
[Greg] Love you so much, darling.
We'll all be here waiting for you when you come out.
translation.ko: 우리 딸 나올 때까지 다 같이 기다리고 있을 거야

translation.en: Yep.
[Beck] Time to go, my love.
Can I come a little way with her?
-Love you. -[nurse] Yes.
-See ya. Have fun. -[Georgie] Love you.
[nurse] Come inside. It gets cold in there.
[nurse] I'm just gonna connect a few of these.
It just monitors your heart throughout the procedure.
And we're coming in today for gender affirmation surgery?
Everyone in agreeance?
-[all] Yeah. -[nurse] Thank you.
I'm just gonna give you a little oxygen before you're going off to sleep.
translation.ko: 이제 곧 잠드실 텐데 그 전에 산소 좀 공급할게요

translation.en: Okay.
[nurse] So just take some nice, big deep breaths for me there.
[presenter] And the winner of the Young People's Human Rights Medal
for 2017 is Georgie Stone.
translation.ko: 2017년 청소년 인권 메달 수상자를 발표하겠습니다 조지 스톤

translation.en: It is an honor to be receiving this award today.
translation.ko: 이렇게 큰 상을 받다니 너무나도 영광입니다

translation.en: A few months ago,
I was talking to a group of trans kids between the ages of 8 and 12,
and I was shocked to learn that every single one of them was,
translation.ko: 아이들 얘기를 듣고서 충격을 금치 못했죠

translation.en: at that time, being bullied at school.
translation.ko: 한 아이도 빠짐없이 학교에서 괴롭힘을 당하고 있더군요

translation.en: So even though we have achieved a lot, we still need to make sure
translation.ko: 지금껏 많은 성과를 냈지만 여기서 멈춰선 안 됩니다

translation.en: that we are protecting and looking after trans kids in Australia.
translation.ko: 호주에 있는 모든 트랜스 아동을 우리가 보호하고 돌봐야 합니다

translation.en: [Greg] How do you feel about the medical treatment
that you want to have?
I feel good about that.
[Greg] Why?
Well, because then… then I won't grow into a boy. I'll…
translation.ko: 그 치료를 받으면 이다음에 커서 남자가 안 되니까요

translation.en: I'll be myself.
[interviewer] Michelle. Okay, great.
So, Michelle, can you say your name for me and your, um, position?
translation.ko: 미셸, 성함과 직위를 포함해 자기소개를 해주시겠어요?

translation.en: My name is Associate Professor Michelle Telfer,
translation.ko: 제 이름은 미셸 텔퍼이고 부교수로 교직에 있습니다

translation.en: and I'm the head of Department of Adolescent Medicine
and director of the Gender Service at the Royal Children's Hospital.
translation.ko: 청소년 의학과장인 동시에 젠더 클리닉 책임자입니다

translation.en: For every young person who comes to see us,
there's a very thorough assessment that takes place
before a big decision like hormone treatment
translation.ko: 호르몬 치료 등을 진행할지는 중대한 문제이기 때문에

translation.en: is… is decided upon.
But even with this thorough process,
for many, many years in Australia, young people had to go to court
translation.ko: 지금까지 수많은 호주 청소년이 법정에서 싸워 이겨야만

translation.en: to access the treatment they needed.
When Georgie was 13,
she and her family decided to challenge that.
translation.ko: 가족과 함께 그 힘든 도전에 나서기로 했죠

translation.en: To have a complete stranger having to make a decision about my body
translation.ko: 난생처음 보는 타인한테 내 몸에 대한 결정권을 넘기라뇨

translation.en: was really distressing, and I felt really powerless.
So we appealed to change both Stage 1 and Stage 2 treatments
translation.ko: 그래서 1차 및 2차 치료 관련 법을 개정해 달라는 소송을 제기했어요

translation.en: so, um, trans kids and their families wouldn't have to go to court.
translation.ko: 트랜스 아동이 가족과 함께 법정에 서지 않아도 되게요

translation.en: And we won, but it was only a partial victory.
So they, uh… they changed the law surrounding Stage 1,
so then, um, families didn't have to go to court for Stage 1 treatment,
translation.ko: 트랜스 아동이 법정에 안 가고도 1차 치료는 받을 수 있게 됐는데

translation.en: but the law still stood for Stage 2.
So what it meant for me was that I did have to go back to court,
and that was really scary.
I can't get, um, female hormones without the permission of court.
translation.ko: 법원이 허가해 주지 않으면 여성 호르몬을 투여할 수 없어요

translation.en: They give the order, and it's not in the power of the doctors,
translation.ko: 법원 명령이 떨어져야 하는데 의사 소견도 아무 소용 없고

translation.en: the parents, or me.
I don't have, legally, the right to make that decision.
translation.ko: 제게는 스스로 결정할 법적 권한이 없죠

translation.en: I need to…
um, they needed to determine whether I was Gillick competent,
translation.ko: 저한테 길릭 권한이 있다고 법원이 인정해 줘야만 했어요

translation.en: which means I know what the effects will be.
translation.ko: 제가 받으려는 의료 행위가 어떤 영향을 미칠지 아냐는 건데요

translation.en: I need the estrogen tablets. I need to go through female puberty.
translation.ko: 전 에스트로겐 알약이 필요해요 여성으로 2차 성징을 겪어서

translation.en: I get boobs. [laughs] I get, um, curves, you know,
translation.ko: 가슴도 나오고 몸매에 곡선이 생겨야 하니까요

translation.en: things that girls have, and I need it.
I need it to be myself,
and if I don't get it, I'm not gonna be happy.
I'm not gonna be myself.
I've got a pimple…
which is… I'm actually happy about,
translation.ko: 여드름이 났다는 건… 솔직히 기분이 좀 좋네요

translation.en: sort of.
It means that the tablets are working, and I'm…
translation.ko: 약이 효과가 있다는 거고 여기도 변화가…

translation.en: Uh, well, it's working. [laughs] Yay.
Firstly, kinda like to say thank you so much for having us. Um…
So thankful that I'm able to speak today, and hopefully we can do some good.
translation.ko: 오늘 발언권을 주심에 감사드리고 유익한 성과가 있으면 좋겠습니다

translation.en: Okay, so, my name is Georgie Stone. I'm 15 years old.
Last year, we had to apply to the Family Court of Australia
translation.ko: 작년에 저희는 가정 법원에 소송을 제기해야 했습니다

translation.en: to obtain Stage 2 treatment, which is cross-sex hormones.
translation.ko: 교차 성호르몬을 투여하는 2차 치료를 받기 위해서였죠

translation.en: For the last five years,
court has played a big part in my family's life.
translation.ko: 법원은 저희 가족의 삶을 크게 뒤흔들어 놨습니다

translation.en: At times, it overshadowed everything else.
translation.ko: 때론 법정 싸움에 지쳐 웃음을 영영 잃은 듯했죠

translation.en: I want to make sure this doesn't play the same part in anyone else's life.
translation.ko: 법원이 다른 이의 삶에는 그림자를 드리우지 않길 바랍니다

translation.en: The court process is slow, biology is fast.
translation.ko: 재판은 느리게 진행되는 반면에 생물학적 시간은 빠르게 흐릅니다

translation.en: The lives of trans kids are challenging at every turn.
translation.ko: 트랜스 아동들의 삶에는 고난이 끊이지 않습니다

translation.en: As parents, we walk ahead of our child, almost like a landmine detector,
translation.ko: 우리 부모들은 한발 앞서 마치 지뢰 탐지기라도 된 듯이

translation.en: sweeping the terrain before us, paving a safe pathway for them.
translation.ko: 아이가 갈 길을 살피고 닦으며 안전하게 걸을 수 있도록 지켜주죠

translation.en: Most parents exhaust themselves creating a safe place at school,
translation.ko: 아이의 안전한 학교생활을 위해서 안간힘을 다하고 계실 줄로 압니다

translation.en: educating family and friends,
translation.ko: 가족과 친지의 잘못된 생각을 바로잡느라 지치셨겠죠

translation.en: often being accused of causing it in the first place or of child abuse.
translation.ko: 심지어 원인을 제공했다는 비난과 아동 학대 의심을 받기도 합니다

translation.en: Dealing with their own feelings of being overwhelmed and isolated,
translation.ko: 벅차고 고립된 감정을 스스로 다잡아야 하고

translation.en: finding appropriate medical support, family breakdown, kids harming themselves.
translation.ko: 적절한 의료 지원을 받기 위해서 고군분투합니다 그 과정에서 가정이 무너지고 아이가 자해하는 일도 다반사죠

translation.en: The pressure is enormous and relentless.
translation.ko: 극심하고 가차 없는 압박감에 시달리고 있습니다

translation.en: To add court to this already intensely challenging situation
translation.ko: 이처럼 이미 극도로 어려운 상황에 법원마저 짐을 지우다니

translation.en: is unnecessary and cruel.
Legislation through Parliament is our last hope,
translation.ko: 국회의 개정안 제정이 우리에게 남은 마지막 희망이니

translation.en: so please help us.
[Greg] How did you feel when you went to see Dr. Paul?
translation.ko: 폴 박사님 처음 만났을 때 기분이 어땠어?

translation.en: Yeah.
After Dr. Paul, I felt much happier, much more safe.
translation.ko: 폴 박사님 만나고 나니까 덜 불안하고 기분 좋았어요

translation.en: [Greg] You didn't feel safe before that?
Well…
Well, no,
'cause not… not that many people understood about me.
translation.ko: 나를 이해해 주는 사람이 별로 없었거든요

translation.en: [Dr. Telfer] Are you happy to talk about the estrogen today and how that's going?
Last time I saw you, we increased the dose.
Yeah, two milligrams.
-[Dr. Telfer] Yeah, how's that going? -It's been good.
I mean, I do notice I get a bit more annoyed at my parents than before.
translation.ko: 확실히 부모님께 전보다 짜증을 더 내는 것 같아요

translation.en: -Can you tell? -[Beck] No.
And even if you were, I don't think I'd take a blind bit of notice.
translation.ko: 네가 짜증 부린다 해도 엄마는 눈감아 줄 거야

translation.en: -Oh, good. -[Beck] So--
Okay, so next time, you might get a little bit of sassiness.
translation.ko: 이제부턴 제가 좀 버릇없게 굴지도 몰라요

translation.en: Will… will you mind? Okay, that's fine.
[Beck] All I notice is that you are feeling good about yourself,
translation.ko: 엄마가 보기엔 요즘에 너 자신한테 만족하는 것 같아

translation.en: and that because you're feeling good about yourself,
your focus is very positive on other things
and that you're determined to make the best life for yourself.
translation.ko: 이제 너를 위해 최선의 삶을 살아야겠다 싶을 거고

translation.en: A lot of our work has revolved around law reform for trans kids,
translation.ko: 트랜스 아동을 위한 법 개정에 힘쓰고 있어요

translation.en: 'cause they have to apply to the Family Court of Australia
translation.ko: "맬컴 턴불 총리" 지금은 치료를 받기 위해선 소송을 제기해야 하거든요

translation.en: -Right. -[Georgie] …to access treatment.
translation.ko: 지금은 치료를 받기 위해선 소송을 제기해야 하거든요

translation.en: Yeah. Great.
You've got a way to go with trans awareness, do you think?
translation.ko: 트랜스에 대한 인식 개선이 아직 요원하다고 생각하나요?

translation.en: [Georgie] This isn't really a new issue, but in the public eye, it is.
translation.ko: 사실 오래전부터 계속된 문제지만 일반 대중에게는 낯설 거예요

translation.en: So there is a long way to go making sure we battle the social stigma,
translation.ko: 그러니 사회적 오명을 씻자면 아직 갈 길이 멀죠

translation.en: um, which is ingrained in our society.
Hey, so, update.
I'm gonna talk a little bit about boys.
Okay, so I've had a crush on this guy for about ten months,
big crush, um,
and turns out he had a crush on my best friend.
translation.ko: 그런데 알고 보니까 걔는 제 절친한테 반했더라고요

translation.en: [Dr. Telfer] Uh, it's nearly three years, isn't it?
Having estrogen before you're even looking at having
any of those sort of major surgical procedures.
translation.ko: 주요 외과 수술을 고려하기 전부터 에스트로겐을 복용했잖니

translation.en: I can… I can do it.
My teachers all support me, and why shouldn't I do it?
translation.ko: 학교 선생님들도 응원해 주시고 하면 안 될 이유도 없죠

translation.en: I've waited so long. [Dr. Telfer] Yeah.
-And at 18, you're an adult. -[Georgie] Yeah.
You can make those decisions, and clearly you've got the ability
translation.ko: 스스로 결정할 권리가 생겼고 능력도 충분히 갖췄지

translation.en: to… to make a really good, informed decision, and it's totally up to you.
translation.ko: 모든 사항을 알고 잘 결정할 테니 너한테 달렸어

translation.en: [Georgie] So, yeah.
[Georgie] Going into the clinic today,
I started thinking, "Okay, this is gonna happen."
-This is happening. -[Beck] Yeah, I know. I know.
translation.ko: - 때가 온 거죠 - 무슨 말인지 알아

translation.en: Yeah.
Really, the meaning of it is all… you.
[Georgie] Yeah.
[Beck] It's nobody else.
Yeah.
I have my feelings about it because I want you to be…
translation.ko: 물론 엄마도 생각이 있기는 하지 우리 딸이…

translation.en: who you want to be, and I want you to be safe.
translation.ko: 엄마는 네가 원하는 삶을 안전하게 살아가길 바라거든

translation.en: [Beck] But…
it's… it's just you.
It's just for you.
I don't want it to change things though.
translation.ko: 모든 게 달라질 텐데 그렇게 만들고 싶진 않아요

translation.en: [tearfully] I don't want to be trans.
But it is who I am, so I can't really…
translation.ko: 그런데 이게 진짜 저니까 어쩔 수 없이…

translation.en: I try not to think about, "Oh, I wish I wasn't trans."
translation.ko: 이런 생각은 안 하려고 해요 '트랜스가 아니면 좋을 텐데'

translation.en: I am trans, and I have to live with it.
And I will have to live with it all my life.
I don't want this operation to change anything
'cause I'm really happy.
translation.ko: 수술하더라도 모든 게 그대로면 좋겠어요 저 진짜 행복해요

translation.en: And, yeah, I don't have the body that I want,
but I'm still female.
And I just don't want this operation to change who I am.
Obviously, I want it to change my body, but I don't want it…
I don't want it to change people's perceptions of me.
translation.ko: 사람들이 저를 다르게 보는 건 싫어요

translation.en: I don't want it to change how I live my life and…
translation.ko: 그 무엇도 바꾸기 싫어요 지금 이 삶이 좋고

translation.en: [sniffles] I still want to be Georgie.
[Greg] Sweetie.
Hey.
[Beck] You've had a lovely sleep.
-[weakly] I'm tired. -[Beck] Mmm.
[Greg] You just keep sleeping as long as you like.
[Beck] Okay. And is Justice Thackray
going to deliver that from court
or in chambers or…
The judgment is gonna be handed down tomorrow at midday.
It could all be over tomorrow.
That's crazy. It's like all that work,
translation.ko: 말도 안 돼요 우리가 얼마나 애써 왔어요?

translation.en: everything is leading up to tomorrow.
translation.ko: 내일 단 하루 만에 끝나도 돼요?

translation.en: [Beck] That would mean a whole bunch of our friends
wouldn't have to go through it. The kids wouldn't have to go through it.
translation.ko: 다른 친구들과 아이들은 겪지 않아도 되는 거야

translation.en: [Georgie] My family and I were able to reform Stage 1, so we didn't have to go to court,
translation.ko: 1차 치료 관련 법 개정에 성공해서 소송 없이 치료받을 수 있게 됐죠

translation.en: but you still have to for Stage 2.
translation.ko: 하지만 2차 치료를 위해선 여전히 법정에 서야 해요

translation.en: Stage 2 treatment is cross-sex hormones.
That's beginning the puberty that you want to undertake.
And this treatment for trans kids is vital for our mental health,
translation.ko: 트랜스 아동의 건강을 위해서 필수적인 치료예요 정신적으로도 육체적으로도

translation.en: for our physical health.
We really need this treatment.
My mum and I and lots of people
have been rallying support for this cause to get this process out of the courts.
translation.ko: 법원의 개입을 배제하기 위한 소송을 지지하고 있어요

translation.en: And hopefully, all that work has paid off.
-We'll see. -[reporter] We'll see.
[Dr. Telfer] We won!
[Beck] Oh my God.
-[Dr. Telfer] Congratulations. -[crying softly]
Congratulations.
[friend] The world's changing, hey?
Oh, darling girl.
[whispers] We won.
Can't believe it. [sobs]
-[cork pops] -Oh jeez!
And to all of you for looking after our kids,
translation.ko: 우리 아이들을 위해 애쓴 모두를 위해 건배할게요

translation.en: thank you, thank you.
For the next ten, twenty, thirty years,
we will see young people benefit from this,
and… I suspect that
those young people won't understand what you've been through
translation.ko: 네가 어떤 일을 겪어 냈는지는 아이들이 알아주지 않을 거야

translation.en: and won't understand the significance of that freedom
that they have to just access the treatment they need,
translation.ko: 단지 필요한 치료를 받는 데에 무슨 자유가 필요하냐 싶겠지

translation.en: but we will always remember
that, Georgie, it was you
that fought this first.
[tearfully] Thank you.
-[woman 1] Cheers. -[woman 2] Cheers.
[Georgie] Over this past week,
I… I was scared.
-[Beck] Mmm. -How I couldn't move my legs.
Um, couldn't get out of the bed, feeling trapped in there,
translation.ko: 침대에서 벗어날 수 없으니 갇힌 기분이었어요

translation.en: feeling sick a lot of the time.
It was just there were so many things happening to my body.
All because of this operation that I wanted.
translation.ko: 내가 그토록 원했던 수술 때문에 이렇게 되다니

translation.en: Um, I started a little bit to resent… resent it,
or scared of resenting it,
translation.ko: 억울한 마음이 드는 것 자체가 무서웠달까요

translation.en: which is probably the truth.
I was scared of resenting this thing that I wanted,
translation.ko: 이 수술을 그토록 갈망해 놓고는 이제 와서 억울하니까 두려웠죠

translation.en: but… what made me so happy this morning,
when… when my dressing came off
and I saw my vagina for the first time,
is that when I saw it, I didn't hate it.
translation.ko: 그걸 딱 봤는데 싫지 않아서 기뻤어요

translation.en: Um, I loved it. And I said, "That's my vagina."
And I really loved it.
Uh, swollen, stitches, all of it.
You know.
It didn't matter.
-[Beck] Mmm. -I still loved it.
I might try acting, so I'm doing drama classes.
translation.ko: 연기에 도전해 보려고 요즘 수업을 듣고 있어요

translation.en: I would love to play a trans person in a film about
translation.ko: 제가 꼭 연기하고 싶은 배역은요 영화 속 트랜스예요

translation.en: all trans topics and make it realistic.
translation.ko: 트랜스에 대한 주제라면 다 좋죠 현실감 넘치게 연기하고 싶어요

translation.en: [writer] Welcome.
[Georgie] Thank you very much.
We're really, really excited to tell the story,
and, uh, this is, um, the Neighbours story team.
So we just wanted to kind of get your guidance
to what is appropriate and what isn't appropriate. Yeah.
translation.ko: 어떤 표현을 써도 되는지 쓰면 안 되는지 알려줘요

translation.en: So, "transgender," is that an okay term?
-[Georgie] Transgender is the term. -Is the correct…
[Georgie] Or trans.
In terms of pronouns, she, her.
-[writer] Yeah. -Very simple.
Obviously, when you meet new people, and they just know you as Georgie…
translation.ko: 처음 만나는 사람은 조지를 있는 그대로 보잖아요

translation.en: [Georgie] Yeah.
…when they eventually or if they eventually learn -that you're transgender… -Yeah.
translation.ko: 조지가 트랜스젠더라는 걸 뒤늦게 알기도 할 텐데요

translation.en: …do they change at all in how they interact with you?
translation.ko: 그럼 조지를 대하는 방식이 조금이라도 달라지던가요?

translation.en: Well, I… I do… I do think there are some assumptions
translation.ko: 저에 대해 넘겨짚는 것 같긴 해요

translation.en: when meeting new people completely about what my experience has been.
translation.ko: 제가 어떤 삶을 살아왔는지 모르는 사람들은 흔히 그러죠

translation.en: A big one that a lot of people have is,
"Oh, so you were born a boy, but you want to be a girl."
And how I see my experience is
translation.ko: 그런데 저는 제 삶을 돌아봤을 때 이런 생각을 해요

translation.en: that I have always been female,
even… even when I was, you know, two and a half, and I had short hair,
and people said "he," used male pronouns.
Um, I still see myself then as female, but I was assigned male at birth.
translation.ko: 그때도 지금도 스스로를 여성으로 생각해요 태어났을 때 지정 성별이 남성이었을 뿐이죠

translation.en: Based on that experience that you're describing,
translation.ko: 조지가 어떻게 살아왔는지 쭉 들어 보니까 알겠어요

translation.en: the character would have always known.
Yeah. I've… I've always known who I am.
I've always been a girl.
Why would he do that? I just wonder if there's another beat in here.
translation.ko: 여기서 왜 이러는 걸까요? 어떤 또 다른 변화가 있었을까요?

translation.en: [crew member] Do you like that?
Stand by.
-Thank you. -[crew member] Mark cue.
[crew member] And set. Cameras are set.
And… action!
[kisses] For big ever.
